heading: Welcome
text:
Cover image: Naples Sir William Hamilton’s Villa, 1780–1782 John Warwick Smith.
Source: Birmingham Museums Trust.list collects personal favorite free typefaces overused (yet).

heading: 1.1 Specimen
text:
Fire Island Beach barrier sand, stretching twenty miles
            along south coast Long Island, separating Great South Bay
            Atlantic ocean.
        
            reach , must make sail three seven miles, 
            upon , find wild, desolate, solitary spot, wind-searched 
            surf-pounded.
        
            inner shore covered growth tide-wet sedge, 
            spot dry meadow comes make landing-place.
        
            outline inner shore irregular, curving bending
            back upon , making coves points creeks 
            channels, often pushing flats water enough 
            low tide wet ankles.
        
            third distance across Beach, meadow ends sand
            begins. slopes gradually another third distance, 
            foot sand hills, seem tumbled places 
            mighty power, sometimes three tiers deep, sometimes two, 
            sometimes one.
        
            sand hills striking features Beach. 
            biggest sixty feet high, yet hard feat 
            climb top, extended view —one
            side wide Bay, , ocean stretching restless
            surface horizon—feel upon elevation tenfold
            high.
        
            hills wind makes great galloping, whirling deep
            bowl-shape hollows among , piling shifting sand upon 
            summits. Now notice hill shoulder knocked
            wind, ton sand gone one can tell . every
            storm contour changes, yet general formation 
            similar times change seldom thought . coarse
            spear-like grass finds sparse growth upon , can
            hold sand place; hard time , blades
            buried tips naked roots often testify.
        
            one part Beach ever much . 
            broad, shelving strip sand hills sea, 
            tide rises falls, pounding grinding, year year —
            play-ground battle-ground surf.
        
            summer's day, seen surf low quiet one 
            launch sharpie upon , single-handed, come ashore without
            shipping quart water. times terror look —
            steady break waves upon outer bar, row row coming ,
            rearing plunging strike shore. sea 
            launching yawl surf-boat, coming ashore.
        
            tide right moon wind blown gale 
            southeast, strand entirely submerged, people upon 
            main shore three miles away can see surf breaking Beach
            hills.
